intro: Didissandra begoniifolia, commonly known as the begoniifolia didissandra, is a rare and striking member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves that resemble those of begonias, hence its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are followed by dark blue berries. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is highly sought after by collectors and requires specific care to thrive in cultivation.
